introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.content: Cuizly Inc. ("Cuizly", "we", "our") respects your privacy and is committed to protecting your personal data. This policy explains what information we collect, how we use it, who we share it with and what your rights are under applicable laws (Quebec and Canada).

collection.title: 2. Information we collect
collection.content: We may collect the following categories:
items: Identification information: name, first name, email address, encrypted password.
Culinary and food preferences: favorite cuisines, restrictions, allergens.
Location data: only with your explicit consent (e.g. delivery radius, neighborhood).
Usage information: pages visited, restaurants viewed, interactions with the application.
Analytics and technical data: device type, operating system, connection identifiers, cookies.

usage.title: 3. How we use your information
items: Provide, personalize and improve the Service.
Generate personalized recommendations via AI.
Send you relevant notifications (e.g. offers, reminders).
Analyze usage to improve our features.
Ensure security and prevent fraud.

sharing.title: 4. Information sharing
sharing.intro: We do not sell your personal data.
sharing.content: We may share your information only:
items: With your explicit consent.
With third-party service providers (hosting, payment, analytics) who are required to respect confidentiality.
To comply with a legal obligation or protect our rights.
In connection with a merger, acquisition or reorganization of Cuizly (with reasonable notice).

cookies.title: 5. Cookies and similar technologies
cookies.content: We use cookies and similar technologies to:
items: Maintain your active session.
Analyze performance and usage.
Personalize content.
cookies.footer: You can manage your preferences via your browser or app settings.

rights.title: 6. Your rights
rights.content: In accordance with Quebec and Canada laws, you can:
items: Access your personal data.
Correct or update your information.
Withdraw your consent (to the extent permitted by law).
Request the deletion or limitation of the processing of your data.

security.title: 7. Data security
security.content: We use technical and organizational measures (encryption, access controls, internal audits) to protect your data. As no system is invulnerable, we cannot guarantee absolute security.

retention.title: 8. Data retention
paragraphs: Your data is retained as long as necessary to provide the Service, or in accordance with legal obligations.
In case of prolonged inactivity, your account may be deleted after notice.

minors.title: 9. Data from minors
paragraphs: The Service is not intended for children under 15 years old.
Users aged 15 and under must obtain consent from a parent or guardian.

transfers.title: 10. Transfers outside Quebec/Canada
transfers.content: Some service providers may be located outside Quebec/Canada. In this case, your data may be transferred outside, but always with appropriate contractual and legal protections.

modifications.title: 11. Policy modifications
modifications.content: We may update this Privacy Policy. Any modifications will be published with a new update date. Your continued use of the Service after publication constitutes acceptance.

contact.title: 12. Contact
contact.content: For any questions, requests or complaints:

howItWorks.title: A culinary copilot everywhere with you
howItWorks.subtitle: Cuizly Assistant helps you discover the best restaurants, new flavors and recipes.

hosting.title: 2. Hosting
hosting.address: Address: San Francisco, California, United States

intellectual.title: 4. Intellectual property
intellectual.intro: The entire Cuizly.ca site (texts, images, logos, graphics, videos, source codes, structure, databases, etc.) is protected by Canadian and international legislation on copyright and intellectual property.
intellectual.p1: Any reproduction, representation, modification, publication, transmission or distortion, in whole or in part, of the site or its content, is prohibited without prior written authorization from Cuizly Technologies.
intellectual.p2: The trademarks, logos and other distinctive signs present on the site are the property of Cuizly or third parties having authorized their use.

userContent.title: 5. User content (reviews, photos, contributions)
userContent.intro: Users can publish content (reviews, comments, photos, descriptions, etc.) on the site or application.
userContent.guarantee: By publishing content, you guarantee that:
guaranteeItems: you have all necessary rights (e.g. on your photos, texts, videos),
this content is accurate and does not violate third party rights (copyright, image rights, trademarks, etc.),
this content is not defamatory, hateful, discriminatory, illegal or contrary to public order.
userContent.rights: You retain your rights to your contributions, but you grant Cuizly a worldwide, free, non-exclusive and transferable license to use, reproduce, modify, publish, translate, distribute and display this content as part of the service (in particular to make it visible to other users).
userContent.moderation: Moderation: Cuizly reserves the right to moderate, refuse, delete or disable any user content that violates the law, third party rights or these legal terms, without notice or compensation.
userContent.responsibility: Users remain solely responsible for the content they publish. Cuizly cannot be held responsible for content published by third parties.

personal.title: 6. Personal data
personal.content: In accordance with applicable laws in Quebec and Canada (Law 25, PIPEDA), you have a right of access, rectification, portability and deletion of your personal data.
personal.link: For more information, see our Privacy Policy.

liability.title: 7. Liability
liability.availability: Availability: Cuizly strives to keep the site accessible, but cannot guarantee the absence of interruptions, technical errors or bugs.
liability.usage: Usage: The user is solely responsible for the use he makes of the site and the information available.
liability.equipment: Equipment: Cuizly cannot be held responsible for direct or indirect damage caused to the user's equipment (e.g. incompatibilities, viruses, data loss).
liability.externalLinks: External links: The site may contain links to third party sites. Cuizly declines all responsibility concerning the content or operation of these sites.

law.title: 8. Applicable law and jurisdiction
law.applicableLaw: These legal mentions are governed by Quebec and Canadian law.
law.jurisdiction: Any dispute related to the use of the site will be submitted to the competent courts of the judicial district of Montreal (QC).

terms.title: Cuizly Terms of Use
terms.intro: Welcome to Cuizly (the "Service"), operated by Cuizly Technologie Inc. ("Cuizly", "we", "our"). By accessing the Service, you accept these Terms.

acceptance.title: 1) Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By accessing or using the Service (website, iOS app, API, content), you confirm that you have read, understood and accepted these Terms as well as the policies referenced therein (e.g. Privacy Policy). If you do not accept, do not use the Service.

service.title: 2) Service description
service.content: Cuizly is a platform that connects consumers to restaurants in Quebec and offers personalized culinary recommendations and offers through AI. Some features (e.g. reservations, orders, restaurant accounts) may be deployed gradually.

eligibility.title: 3) Eligibility and Account
items: You must be 15 years old or older (or have parental/guardian authorization if you are under 14).
You agree to provide accurate information and keep it up to date.
You are responsible for the confidentiality of your credentials and activity performed under your account.
We may suspend or terminate an account in case of violation.

acceptable.title: 4) Acceptable use
items: Disrupt or attempt to disrupt the Service, bypass security measures, engage in unauthorized reverse engineering.
Upload, post or transmit illegal, defamatory, hateful, deceptive or infringing content.
Use the Service in a manner contrary to applicable laws (Quebec/Canada) or these Terms.

intellectual.title: 5) Content and Intellectual Property
paragraphs: All texts, visuals, logos, interfaces, software and other elements of the Service are the property of Cuizly or its licensors and are protected by intellectual property laws.
Subject to your compliance with the Terms, Cuizly grants you a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable license to access and use the Service for personal and non-commercial purposes.
You may not reproduce, distribute, modify, rent, sell or create derivative works from the Service without written authorization.

userContent.title: 6) User-provided content
paragraphs: You can publish reviews, preferences, photos, etc. You retain your rights to this content.
You grant Cuizly a worldwide, non-exclusive, free, transferable and sublicensable license to use, reproduce, modify, publish, translate, distribute and display this content as part of the Service.
You guarantee that you have all necessary rights and that your content does not violate any rights or laws.

thirdParty.title: 7) Third-party information, Offers and Restaurants
paragraphs: Menus, prices, availability, wait times, discounts, allergens and other information displayed may come from third parties and may change without notice.
Cuizly makes reasonable efforts for accuracy, without warranty of completeness.
Restaurants are responsible for their products, quality of service and compliance with health standards.
Allergies & restrictions: always check directly with the restaurant before ordering or consuming. AI recommendations are indicative.

payment.title: 8) Payment and reservation features (if available)
paragraphs: Payments, reservations or orders may be processed via third-party providers. Additional terms and fees may apply.
Cancellation/refund policies are the responsibility of the restaurant or third-party provider concerned. Cuizly is not a party to restaurant-customer transactions, except as expressly stated.

privacy.title: 9) Data, privacy and AI
paragraphs: Use of the Service involves the processing of personal data (preferences, approximate location, history, etc.) to provide recommendations.
See the Privacy Policy (linked separately) to learn what data is collected, why, how it is retained and your rights.
AI-generated recommendations are based on available signals and data and may contain margins of error.

thirdPartyServices.title: 10) Third-party services and content
thirdPartyServices.content: The Service may integrate third-party data or links (e.g. maps, reviews, external sites). Cuizly does not endorse these third parties, does not control their content and disclaims all responsibility for them. Use of third-party services is governed by their own terms.

warranties.title: 11) Warranty disclaimers
warranties.content: The Service is provided "as is" and "as available". To the extent permitted by law, Cuizly disclaims all express or implied warranties, including merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose and non-infringement. We do not guarantee that the Service will be uninterrupted, secure or error-free.

liability.title: 12) Limitation of liability
paragraphs: To the extent permitted by law, Cuizly, its officers, employees, partners and agents will not be liable for indirect, special, incidental, punitive or consequential damages, nor for any loss of profits, data, goodwill or opportunities, arising from the use or inability to use the Service.

If our liability is found despite the foregoing, it will be limited to the greater of (a) $100 CAD and (b) the total fees you have paid to Cuizly in the past 12 months, all subject to mandatory laws applicable in Quebec.

indemnification.title: 13) Indemnification
indemnification.content: You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Cuizly and its affiliates against any claims, losses, liabilities, expenses (including reasonable legal fees) arising from your use of the Service, your content or your violation of these Terms or applicable laws.

modifications.title: 14) Service and Terms modifications
modifications.content: We may adapt, suspend or discontinue the Service (in whole or in part) and update these Terms. Modifications take effect upon publication on this page with the update date. Continued use of the Service after publication constitutes acceptance of the revised Terms.

termination.title: 15) Termination
termination.content: We may terminate or suspend access to the Service at any time in case of violation of the Terms or for legitimate reasons. You may stop using the Service and, if applicable, delete your account via settings or by contacting us.

law.title: 16) Applicable law and disputes
law.content: These Terms are governed by the laws of Quebec and Canada applicable, without regard to conflict of laws principles. Any dispute will be submitted to the courts of the judicial district of Montreal (QC), subject to mandatory consumer protection rules.

communications.title: 17) Electronic communications and notices
communications.content: By using the Service, you consent to receive electronic communications (emails, in-app notifications) relating to the Service. You can manage some communication preferences in your settings.

reporting.title: 18) Content reporting and removal
reporting.content: If you believe that content infringes rights (e.g. intellectual property), write to us with relevant details. We will apply a reasonable notice and removal process.

general.title: 19) General provisions
general.content: If a provision is found invalid, the others remain fully in force. Failure by Cuizly to exercise a right does not constitute a waiver. You may not assign your rights/obligations without our written consent; we may assign these Terms in connection with a reorganization or corporate transaction.

what.title: 1. What is a cookie?
paragraphs: A cookie is a small text file saved on your device (computer, tablet, mobile) when you visit a website. It helps recognize your browser, remember your preferences and improve your user experience.
Cookies can be temporary (session cookies deleted when the browser closes) or persistent (cookies retained until their expiration or manual deletion).

essential.title: a) Essential cookies
essential.content: Essential for site operation. They allow for example:
items: authentication and session management,
security (prevent fraudulent access),
access to basic features.

performance.title: b) Performance cookies
performance.content: They collect information about how visitors use the site (pages visited, errors encountered, navigation time).
performance.objective: Objective: improve performance, ergonomics and site speed.

functionality.title: c) Functionality cookies
functionality.content: They help remember your choices and preferences (language, identifier, location).
functionality.objective: Objective: offer a personalized and fluid experience.

thirdParty.title: d) Third-party cookies
thirdParty.content: Some cookies are placed by third-party providers:
items: Google Analytics (audience analysis),
possible marketing or advertising tools (e.g. targeted campaigns).
thirdParty.footer: These third parties apply their own privacy policies. We recommend you consult them.

management.title: 3. Managing your preferences
management.content: You can control and/or delete cookies as you wish:
items: Delete all cookies already installed.
Configure most browsers to block their installation.
management.warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è If you disable essential cookies, some parts of the site may no longer work properly.

disable.title: 4. How to disable cookies (quick guides)
disable.chrome: Chrome: Settings ‚Üí Privacy and security ‚Üí Cookies and other site data
disable.firefox: Firefox: Options ‚Üí Privacy and Security ‚Üí Cookies and site data
disable.safari: Safari: Preferences ‚Üí Privacy ‚Üí Manage website data
disable.edge: Edge: Settings ‚Üí Cookies and site permissions ‚Üí Manage and delete cookies

retention.title: 5. Cookie retention period
items: Session cookies: deleted when the browser closes.
Persistent cookies: retained for a maximum of 12 months, unless you delete them earlier.

editor.title: 6. Site publisher

team.title: The team behind Cuizly
team.subtitle: The two founders reinventing the culinary experience in Canada with AI.
team.founderIntro: The vision of a passionate student transforming the Montreal dining experience
team.journeyDetails: Two years ago, Iker, originally from the Democratic Republic of Congo, made a simple yet powerful observation about Montreal: faced with the immense diversity of multicultural restaurants, there was a lack of a true guide to eat well according to budget and preferences. From this observation came a spark: to design an application with an AI-powered culinary matching system.
team.visionDetails: By partnering with Rayane, his co-founder from Djibouti, Iker transformed a meeting at the University of Montreal into much more than a simple friendship: the birth of a shared passion for innovation. Together, they set themselves an ambitious mission: Transform every piece of data into a personalized experience and redefine how we discover urban dining, through an intelligent, personalized recommendation system truly centered on the user.

footer.tagline: Your culinary copilot everywhere with you.
